CatDescriptText: Mr. John H. Johnson, mail handler, 1342 Clark Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 19, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that cab drivers in general take advantage of other motorists and pedestrians in traffic? As a group, would you call them courteous or discourteous?" answer reads: "I do not think so.  The majority of the cab drivers are courteous."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John H. Johnson wearing moustache and straw hat with light colored striped band, standing with manufacturing buildings in background
